title: Aluminum - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Aluminum fell to 2,877 USD/T on December 12, 2025, down 0.92% from the previous day, though it remains 10.02% higher than a year ago. UK aluminum futures rose toward $2,880 per tonne near a one-month high, supported by improving demand prospects, tight global supply, and Beijing's stimulus measures against its property crisis. Over the past month, prices have fallen slightly by 0.07%.

title: SMM: Secondary Aluminum Alloy Ingot Social Inventory Dips to 48,862 mt on Dec 15
summary: SMM statistics show the combined daily social inventory of secondary aluminum alloy ingots dipped to 48,862 mt on December 15. SMM expects aluminum prices to pull back slightly from high levels in the short term.

title: Emissions-Free Aluminium Smelting Breakthrough Achieved
summary: ELYSIS inert anode technology, developed by Alcoa and Rio Tinto, eliminates CO₂ emissions in aluminum smelting by using permanent non-consumable anodes that produce oxygen instead. A 450 kA commercial-scale cell has been successfully deployed at the Alma smelter in Quebec, marking a major step in heavy industry decarbonization. This innovation supports sustainable applications in packaging, aerospace, automotive, and construction.

title: Alcoa, Ball and Unilever Partner to Launch the First Use of ELYSIS Carbon-Free Smelting Technology in Consumer, Personal and Home Care Packaging
summary: Alcoa, Ball, and Unilever have collaborated to create the first consumer packaging using ELYSIS carbon-free aluminum smelting technology, which eliminates direct GHG emissions and generates oxygen. The aerosol can contains 50% ELYSIS primary aluminum and 50% post-consumer recycled content, offering one of the lowest-carbon packaging solutions. This partnership demonstrates value chain collaboration to accelerate low-carbon innovation and meet consumer demand for sustainable products.

title: Vedanta Aluminium Advances India's Low-Carbon Manufacturing Push with 1.57 Billion Units of Renewable Energy in FY25
summary: Vedanta Aluminium consumed 1.57 billion units of renewable energy in FY25, reducing GHG emissions intensity by 8.96% since FY21 as part of its 2030 decarbonization roadmap. The company implemented energy-saving technologies like patented potlining, achieving 378 million units in savings, and plans to source 1,500 MW of renewable power. Partnerships and 'Communities of Practice' support goals for 30% low-carbon aluminum products.

title: Aluminium Giants Hit Major Milestone with Low-Carbon Production
summary: Elysis (Alcoa and Rio Tinto joint venture) achieved a breakthrough by installing inert anode technology in a 450 kA cell at a smelter, scaling up from a 100 kA pilot used in products like Apple devices and Audi wheels. The technology uses non-carbon materials to avoid CO2 and PFC emissions, with a vertical design extending anode life and potentially reducing costs. It can be retrofitted into existing smelters, aiding decarbonization.

title: Investing In Innovation: GBCCA Showcases New Technology To Close The Recycling Loop For Aluminium Cans
summary: The Global Beverage Can Circularity Alliance (GBCCA) is showcasing technologies like robotics, AI, deposit return systems, and home recycling equipment at Climate Week NYC to boost aluminum can recycling toward 100% by 2050 and 80% by 2030. These innovations aim to recover valuable material from municipal waste and enable closed-loop household recycling. They support aluminum's role in decarbonization due to its high recyclability and low energy needs.

title: Steel - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Steel prices fell to 3045 CNY/T on December 12, 2025, down 0.03% from the previous day, with a 0.10% decline over the past month and 7.36% lower year-over-year. Steel rebar futures dropped toward CNY 3,040 per ton due to ongoing demand uncertainties in China, despite Beijing's reaffirmation of broad economic support measures.

title: HRC Steel - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: HRC Steel traded flat at 907 USD/T on December 12, 2025, with a 6.08% rise over the past month and 34.37% increase year-over-year. The price data was last updated on December 15, 2025, indicating stability amid broader commodity trends.

title: US OCTG imports down 10.0 percent in August 2025
summary: US imports of Oil Country Tubular Goods (OCTG) decreased by 10.0 percent in August 2025. This decline reflects ongoing trends in the steel import market, potentially influencing domestic pricing and supply dynamics.

title: Thyssenkrupp pauses steel production at two sites citing Asian pressure
summary: Europe's largest steelmaker Thyssenkrupp will pause steel production at facilities in Gelsenkirchen, Germany, and Isbergues, France, for about two weeks from mid-December due to a surge in low-cost Asian imports. The French site will operate at 50% capacity for at least four months starting January. The company calls for swift EU trade protection measures to restore sustainable capacity utilization.

title: Iron Ore Declines After China Moves to License Steel Exports
summary: Iron ore futures declined as much as 1.6% after China announced a licensing system for exporting certain steel products starting January 1, 2026. The Ministry of Commerce requires exporters to seek permission for a broad range of steel used in construction, cars, and consumer goods. This comes as China's steel exports are on track for a 2025 record.

title: Government implements new measures to protect Canada's steel industry
summary: Canada is reducing tariff rate quotas for imported steel products effective December 26, 2025, to 20% of 2024 levels for non-FTA partners and 75% for non-CUSMA FTA partners. A 25% global tariff will apply to steel-derivative products, alongside extensions of tariff remissions on U.S. imports. These measures aim to protect Canadian steel from global pressures amid U.S. tariff negotiations.

title: China November crude steel output hits a 23-month low
summary: China's crude steel output in November fell 3% from October, marking six straight months of declines due to thinner margins. This represents the lowest output in 23 months. The reduction impacts global steel supply dynamics.

title: Green Steelmaking Innovation: Tech & Climate Impact 2025
summary: Green steelmaking with hydrogen technology is revolutionizing manufacturing by cutting emissions by 85-95% and challenging traditional blast furnaces. The steel sector, responsible for 7% of global carbon emissions, benefits from initiatives like Europe's HYBRIT, which demonstrates commercial-scale hydrogen-based production. Corporate mandates, infrastructure investments, and supply chain premiums drive demand for certified sustainable steel products.

title: AI Startup Deep.Meta Pushes UK Steel Toward Lower Emissions
summary: Deep.Meta's AI-driven simulations achieved nearly 10% emissions reduction at Spartan UK's Newcastle steel plant using physics-based digital twins. The company is advancing its Deep.Optimiser PhyX system via the UK government's Manchester Prize, aiming for a final in March 2026. Industry leaders emphasize AI's role in enhancing UK steel's competitiveness and net-zero transition.

title: Government implements new measures to protect Canada's steel industry
summary: Canada's government is extending tariff remissions on imported steel to January 31, 2026, to support domestic supply chains amid U.S. tariffs. Measures aim to enhance resilience for sectors like manufacturing and agriculture while protecting jobs. This provides predictability as businesses shift from imported to Canadian steel sources.

title: Copper Claws Back Gains With Base Metals After Friday's 3% Tumble
summary: Copper prices rebounded by up to 1.5% on the London Metal Exchange after dropping 3% on Friday due to a selloff in AI-related shares. The recovery reflects a shift in focus to a tighter market outlook for 2026 amid mine disruptions, green energy demand, and potential US tariffs. As of 12:42 p.m. in Shanghai, copper was priced at $11,656.50 a ton after hitting a record near $12,000.

title: Copper Rises on 2026 Supply Concerns Amid Tariff Uncertainty
summary: Copper prices climbed as much as 1.5% on the London Metal Exchange on Monday, recovering from Friday's 3% losses as investors refocused on long-term supply tightness. Demand from AI infrastructure and renewable energy, along with potential US tariffs and mine constraints, supports expectations for higher prices in 2026. Goldman Sachs forecasts prices between $10,000–$11,000 per ton next year.

title: Copper Plummets Amid Risk-Off Market Sentiment
summary: Copper prices fell more than 3% on Friday amid a risk-off sentiment triggered by profit-taking in AI stocks, reversing earlier weekly gains. ANZ analysts maintain a bullish outlook due to robust fundamentals, including supply disruptions, strong demand from EVs, energy infrastructure in China, and AI investments in the US. The pullback is seen as temporary, not derailing the upward trajectory.

title: How tight supply, AI demand propelled copper towards $12,000
summary: Copper prices approached $12,000 per metric ton driven by tight supply conditions and surging demand from AI applications. The rally highlights structural market imbalances favoring higher prices. Ongoing supply constraints and technology-driven consumption are key propellants.

title: Capital demands soar for new copper supply
summary: The global energy transition is driving high demand for copper, but new supply projects face soaring capital costs, with 13 of 22 analyzed projects delayed and budgets increased. Capstone Copper's Santo Domingo project in Chile saw the largest capex jump of $910 million (55%), boosting annual copper production to 68,500 metric tons. Barrick's Reko Diq in Pakistan, with 15 million metric tons of reserves, plans 377,000 metric tons annual output from 2028 at high capex of $9.14 billion.

title: Fortescue Bolsters Copper Pipeline with Alta Copper Buy
summary: Fortescue Metals Group acquired the remaining 64% stake in Alta Copper for $C139 million to strengthen its long-term copper pipeline. Analysts at RBC Capital Markets view it as a low-risk, low-cost addition with minimal near-term impact on cash flow or earnings. The move diversifies Fortescue's portfolio toward copper for the energy transition while maintaining iron ore focus.

title: LME nickel price rebounds above $14,900 on weak US dollar expectations
summary: The London Metal Exchange (LME) nickel futures price rebounded on December 1, hiking back above the US$14,900/ton level to reach a one-week high. This recovery was driven by expectations of a weak US dollar. The article highlights the positive short-term momentum in nickel prices.

title: Nickel declines on negative price outlook for next year
summary: Nickel prices fell on Tuesday following a downbeat forecast from Goldman Sachs, expecting prices to drop 6% to $14,500 per metric ton by December 2026 due to supply surpluses. The report also notes subdued outlooks for aluminum and lithium. Spot nickel prices were down 0.7% at $14,900 per ton as of 16:07 GMT.

title: On December 15, the SMM #1 refined nickel price was ...
summary: On December 15, the SMM #1 refined nickel price ranged from 114,500–120,200 yuan/mt, averaging 117,350 yuan/mt, down 850 yuan/mt from the previous day. This reflects ongoing weakness in the Chinese nickel market. The update is part of non-ferrous metals pricing coverage.

title: [SMM Analysis] Nickel prices were relatively weak this week, with sluggish spot transactions and continued inventory buildup
summary: Nickel prices remained relatively weak this week, with LME prices falling 2.27% week-over-week amid sluggish spot transactions and inventory buildup. The average SMM #1 refined nickel spot price was 119,350 yuan/mt. This analysis points to persistent market pressures.

title: Weekly Ratings, Targets, Forecast Changes - 12-12-25
summary: A broker trimmed its nickel price forecast by 4% for 2026 while lifting forecasts for copper and coking coal. The revision reflects expectations of supply disruptions supporting firmer commodity prices overall. Nickel outlook remains cautious amid sector adjustments.

title: LME WEEK: Nickel market could stay in oversupply until 2030
summary: The global nickel market is projected to remain in surplus until 2030 due to rapid supply growth from Indonesia, which now accounts for 70% of global supply. Indonesian production is expected to grow 16% in 2025 and 2026, while output outside China and Indonesia is at its lowest since 1990. Despite rising Chinese imports, demand is shifting back to stainless steel as battery usage slows.

title: Nickel - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Nickel prices fell to 14,557.75 USD/T on December 15, 2025, amid persistent oversupply and elevated LME stockpiles exceeding 250,000 tonnes. Indonesia's efforts to curb excess supply through reduced mining quotas have not halted rapid capacity expansion, with Nickel Industries approved to increase its 2025 nickel ore sales quota to 10.5 million wet metric tonnes. Global stainless-steel demand remains muted, offset partially by EV battery usage.

title: Lifezone Metals Advances Kabanga Nickel Project Toward 2026 Final Investment Decision
summary: Lifezone Metals has raised $75 million in H2 2025 to fund pre-FID activities for the Kabanga Nickel Project in Tanzania, one of the world's largest high-grade nickel sulfide deposits. The July 2025 Feasibility Study shows first-quartile costs with AISC of $3.36/lb nickel and after-tax NPV of $1.58 billion. The project advances toward a 2026 Final Investment Decision, de-risking for full-scale execution.

title: FLASH: Indonesia to adjust nickel supply quotas in 2026
summary: Indonesia plans to regulate nickel production in 2026 by setting quotas below this year's 3.19 billion tonnes target amid oversupply concerns. The government will restrict new smelter permits and support downstream development into higher value-added products. Only seven companies currently operate integrated mining and smelting operations.
